intro: Pentadenia microsepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled pentadenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that appear in spring. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. It is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
